intro: Visiania grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered poinsettia, is a species native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers, which are actually modified leaves. Its true flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in the center of the bracts. Visiania grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value, especially during the holiday season.
